course.title: Computer Science Career Preparation
course.catalogDescription: In this course students will begin applying their MWSU education towards building a career in CS. Students will learn how to navigate a career path in CS, explore alternative career paths, and explore opportunities for continuing education and professional development. Students will develop application materials and attempt entrance, exit, and / or certification exams in preparation for graduation, applying to jobs, and applying to graduate schools.

objectives.objective: Determine what types of jobs in CS best match their short and long term career and professional development goals
Locate and navigate resources for finding CS jobs in their desired location
Effectively communicate their skill set and value as an employee to potential employers through letters, resumes, networking, interviews, and other means
Explain the concept that because you can do it, it doesnâ€™t mean you should do it.
Paraphrase professional ethics and codes of conduct from prominent professional societies, such as ACM, IEEE-CS, AIS and (ISC)
Describe ways in which decision-making algorithms could over-represent or under-represent majority and minority groups in society.
Locate and utilize resources for continuing education and professional development to gain or improve specific skillsets in CS or transition in to other career fields (ex. Law)
Prepare effectively for certification exams, assessments, and technical interviews
